meanings.definition: The sensation of flavor perceived in the mouth when eating.
meanings.sent1: Her tastes in food are quite simple, preferring plain dishes.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream had a sweet taste that lingered on her tongue.
meanings.sent3: His taste for spicy food sometimes surprises his friends.
meanings.sent4: The taste of victory was as sweet as honey.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the soup was so delicious that she asked for the recipe.

meanings.definition: A person's liking for particular flavors or foods.
meanings.sent1: His tastes lean towards Italian cuisine, especially pasta dishes.
meanings.sent2: She has a refined taste for exotic fruits and rare spices.
meanings.sent3: His taste for chocolate is unmatched; he can never resist it.
meanings.sent4: Her taste for adventure led her to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent5: Their taste for sushi developed after a trip to Japan.

meanings.definition: The ability to discern what is of good quality or of a high aesthetic standard.
meanings.sent1: His taste in art is impeccable, always choosing the most exquisite pieces.
meanings.sent2: She has a sophisticated taste in fashion, always wearing elegant outfits.
meanings.sent3: His taste for humor is quite unique, finding joy in the simplest jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her taste for music is eclectic, ranging from classical to modern pop.
meanings.sent5: Their taste for interior design transformed their house into a cozy sanctuary.
